organic_results.title: Teachers in bars: From professional to personal self
organic_results.snippet: This article reports findings from a study that investigated the interaction among public-school teachers in a barroom over a three-month period. Research questions focused on the relationship between this setting and the job of teaching and on the meaning of the barroom setting for teachers. Data were collected through participant observation and unstructured tape-recorded interviews. The data suggest that teachers dichotomized their professional and personal identities and that barroom interaction facilitated the transition from a restricted …
